title: Gnowsis
segmentation: Hi, I'm presenting Moses and you start up in Vienna which is helping people to remember.
My name is Leo Solomon and I have a big personal problem which is I don't remember.
I really can't remember everything, so for example when did I last meet hundred threats from AWSI have to look it up in my calendar I have to look it up in my address book.
I'm writing all these things done and if you're a professional venture capitalist, if your professional sales person.
This is what you live on.
You can't remember everything.
You have to write these things down and this is what started this company name.
That many of you have your problem that you have to keep remembering things and you have to write them down in your computer.
And if you look at your own computer, some of you have it open here.
For example, if you are on a sales meeting, you have this invitation email.
Yeah, let's meet this in there.
Talk about the deal you have to offer.
You're dealing at a sales meeting.
There is a time schedule in your outlook calendar with the actual meeting and there's this person you're going to meet.
Or maybe multiple persons you're going to meet.
And this accumulated over a week you've been working on it.
You gotta email you.
Saved attachment somewhere.
Maybe in SharePoint.
Maybe in your file server and so on and so on.
But at the end the only meeting is in your head.
So here in the Middle East is Gray area where there is this meeting.
I have this meeting wherever all information stored and actually it's grey matter.
It's in your head, so most people have the over few on their meetings on their customers on their documents in their head.
The real problem.
Fear is that people have this feeling.
You know it's there.
But you can't look everywhere, so you know there is this meeting.
I can still go, and even if you looked everywhere, you're never sure that you found everything because people forget, so you may have missed that one email.
And this is a problem.
So what causes does now is quite simple.
First, we replace the Gray matter in the meeting in the middle with an entity on your computer that sales meeting.
And we do this by reading all these content you have already.
So we analyze your SharePoint.
You analyze your exchange, we analyze your file system.
Semantically, we read the text.
We find what terms are called there and then we see what is related to that meeting automatically.
And this of course is nice, and we've seen it in our presentations already today.
That this is a good thing to do.

But what we also do is we put little plugins into all these applications that can actually click these links, because psychologically, we know that people prefer to click these links when they see them that there is a psychological barrier to close your application, open the search engine, enter some term which you don't know which will misspell.
OK, I'll drink some coffee, do something else.
But if you show the link right where you need it.
People are much more eager to click it so.
If you look at one of these plugins as an example, we have a prototype of this already.
We've been working on this for many years already.
I'm using it since three years.
This is a bit of mock up so it looks a bit better than our prototype, but you'll see what it is.

You have your normal application that you're using every day and you see what is related is one meeting the email, the calendar entry, the offer you're discussing and you'll see the other things that are related to the content or to the context or zone.
And this plugin is so easy to do that we can put it into SharePoint.
We can put it into.
Here also look we can put it into Salesforce where we want because it's not visualizing the semantics is not so hard to do.

Gartner said that people are spending one hour a day searching, so there is a lot of potential to help people remember and find these things because they actually have to walk down these little file structure folders and so on.
So we will help help a lot of people finding things by saving them 30 minutes a day, which is really nice.
And also we give them confidence which is emotionally very important.
You know, when you look at something, you have the links that the system finds and you can also add manual links.
So if the system is too stupid.
Which some semantic systems are then you can add a manual link that you can click, which is also nice.
And 3rd we are working on a group model where you can exchange information.
Here we can work collaboratively exchanging these links, putting your projects and data.
Give 'em so our market target audience is first executed.
People project management, people management people who are often dealing in multiple projects who have multiple people to manage with multiple topics.
Stuff to work on with.
The Reporter disappears and so on.
You can estimate it there.
Around 385 thousand of those in Germany and around 2 million 216 thousand in Europe.
And the nice thing about this group is that they're very coherent.
They all look the same.
They all work the same way.
Basically they're using SharePoint and exchange Salesforce, Google Calendar.
The smaller companies.
So we have a very homogeneous market of software products where we can hook into.
Of course, the corporate market is.
Appealing, so if you look at the corporate market we see this awesome market we want to do and actually people are calling us.
So we've been doing this for six years now.
In research projects people know about us.
Every month I get a call by someone else who wants to integrate it into his Corporation.
So we're working on a model to get this into the into the company service to have these available as a plugin in everyday applications.
But you know, until you sell it and until they give you the cash on your bank account, usually there is a sales cycle of two years.
So this is a lot of time during today's market where venture capital is not so easy to get as a few years ago and we have a crisis in general.
So what we're doing is we're looking at a different market, namely all these SMS out there that have quicker decision rounds that can order software on themselves and that are also available market.
In Europe especially, So what we're doing currently is we're working on a software sales model where we implement this as a web platform.
The disk we're doing now, and this will be done in around April.
It's very simple.
It's really only the basic core of the system to show available product that can work.

And based on that on the next four months, figuring your sales force integration together in a joint venture with a company in Vienna who already did this with another product sales force integration, and there is two other systems which we're going to integrate X&Y also major software service suppliers, which I'm not going to tell now because there's a big secret.
So we want to convert 3000 people of this market.
We're realistic here because we know around 1000 people.

Personally, I've given 90 talks about this topic in the last years I've met on conferences, I've collected all these business cards with 18 leads that contacted us and said, hey, I know you're doing this thing.
Can you do it?
And there were eleven journalists wrote about us.
We there was an article about me published in a 50,000 as well.
There's many, many ways how we can reach these 3000 people and asked him to pay 20 Euro a month for our product.
Currently we are eight people contributing Martina Girl over doing innovation, management and marketing is here in the audience.
So the marketing questions going to her direction.
We have another 10 people waiting with whom we have worked in the last years who know the topic were top people and would be willing to work if we got more cash.
Currently we already created 30 two person months of intellectual property with a budget of around 130,000 euro available for us.
Currently with Angel investor already.

We worked six year on preparing this and there was an 11 million Euro union project European Union project which funded all the research and we're also pushing it out to Linux so this thing has proven to work.
Currently we could use it 1000 Euro to transfer this size thing in the next four months and then we can use another 1000 euro to integrate with the two SS solutions.
So if you can help us to get this we can help people remember.
If you have questions, you get an answer and small talk from you.
I'm driving the.
So one question.
So we started with desktop up where we have much experience, but it was a hard business model to sorry it is also hard business model to compute through.

So what we're doing now is we changed the architecture to something scalable and and I'm one of the top experts in RDF here because I've been doing it very long and so we're using a bit different platform than many other people use using relational databases.
And because they scale.
And we are programming with rapid application development tools like Ruby on Rails, Django.
You know from Subaru what this means that you're very, very fast compared to a picture of a beam of entreaty.
And then we offering API's and a cost model based on this software service thing.
